text: was a Japanese sprinter who in 1935 jointly held the 100 m world record at 10.3 seconds. Four other men had clocked 10.3 s in 1935 or earlier, and Takayoshi was the only Asian person among them. He competed in various sprint events at the 1932 and 1936 Olympics and finished sixth in the 100 m in 1932. In retirement Yoshioka worked as an athletics coach. ==See also== *World Record progression 100 m men ==References== Naoto Tajima, Takayoshi Yoshioka and Ikuko Yoda Category:1909 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Japanese male sprinters Category:University of Tsukuba alumni Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1932 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1936 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Japan
title: Takayoshi Yoshioka
